page.title: 05Wood Pigeon (Ring Dove)
page.content:
Length: 40.5 cm. Size of egg: 37-48 *25-33 mm. Colour: Grey, white, greeny/pinky belly. Country in Summer: Britain/Europe. Country in Winter: Mediterranean. Habitat: Woods, moors and parks.
The Wood Pigeon or Ring Dove can be seen by the middle of March, returning from their winter quarters. The nest is a flimsy structure of twigs, laid in a tree, normally a conifer. The Wood Pigeon will eat seeds, green plants and even earthworms and molluscs. In September and October they leave their nesting grounds again. The Wood Pigeon is a very popular game bird.
